intro: Treleasea leiandra, commonly known as the red-veined ivy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. Treleasea leiandra prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
